name: Food Emergency Law (Ready for Export)
description:
This law establishes the federal response to the food emergency. Anyone planting any of the critical crops identified by this law in an appropriate biome in the Food Preservation District(s) gets paid for planting for the first four days. Only gatherers (level 1 or higher) can harvest in the Food Preservation Districts. The Food Preservation Districts are protected from claiming as well as crop destruction. Crop seed sales earn a tax rebate for the first four days.

Critical Crops: Beans, Beets, Camas, Crimini Mushrooms, Fiddleheads (ferns), Huckleberries, Rice, Papaya, Pineapple, and Taro.

End of Day 3, the districted land will be auctioned to farmers / gatherers.
If land remains, End of Day 4, the districted land will be auctioned off to anyone.
If land remains, End of Day 5, the districts will be removed and the food emergency will be declared over.

Emergency planting payments and crop sales tax rebates end of Day 4.

Parliament expressly authorizes the Minister of Infrastructure to create or modify the Food Preservation Districts governed by this law. The MoI can remove districts to support the auctions but only when the allowed time frames in this law have passed.

\\Implementation Notes: Insert Food Preservation District
